intro: Torilis eminii, commonly known as the Armenian groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, including parts of Armenia and Georgia. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Torilis eminii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
